Package infodynamics.measures.discrete

Class SingleAgentMeasureDiscreteInContextOfPastCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.discrete.InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
      • infodynamics.measures.discrete.ContextOfPastMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
        • infodynamics.measures.discrete.SingleAgentMeasureDiscreteInContextOfPastCalculator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SingleAgentMeasureDiscrete
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActiveInformationCalculatorDiscrete, EntropyRateCalculatorDiscrete, PredictiveInformationCalculatorDiscrete
    public abstract class SingleAgentMeasureDiscreteInContextOfPastCalculator
extends ContextOfPastMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
implements SingleAgentMeasureDiscrete
    A base class for calculators computing measures for a single variable which require knowledge of the embedded past state of a univariate discrete (ie int[]) variable.

    This combines functionality for single agents from SingleAgentMeasureDiscrete with functionality required in the context of the past provided by ContextOfPastMeasureCalculatorDiscrete.

    Usage is as defined in InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete, with extra methods for supplying observations and making calculations defined in SingleAgentMeasureDiscrete

    .

    Users should not need to deal with this class directly; it is simply used to gather common functionality for several child classes.

    TODO Make the Active info storage and entropy calculators inherit from this
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

      • SingleAgentMeasureDiscreteInContextOfPastCalculator

        public SingleAgentMeasureDiscreteInContextOfPastCalculator​(int base,
                                                           int history)
        Construct the calculator
        Parameters:
        base - number of quantisation levels for each variable. E.g. binary variables are in base-2.
        history - embedding length

      • SingleAgentMeasureDiscreteInContextOfPastCalculator

        public SingleAgentMeasureDiscreteInContextOfPastCalculator​(int base,
                                                           int history,
                                                           boolean dontCreateObsStorage)
        Construct the calculator
        Parameters:
        base - number of quantisation levels for each variable. E.g. binary variables are in base-2.
        history - embedding length
        dontCreateObsStorage - do not create storage for observations of the embedded past (as the child class is signalling that it does not need it)

        Description copied from interface: SingleAgentMeasureDiscrete
        Standalone routine to compute the local information-theoretic measure across a time-series of states. Return a time-series array of local values. First history rows are zeros when the measure must build up embedded history of the variable.

        computeLocal in interface SingleAgentMeasureDiscrete
        Parameters:
        states - time series of samples
        Returns:
        time-series of local values (indexed as per states)

        public final double[] computeLocal​(int[][] states,

        Description copied from interface: SingleAgentMeasureDiscrete
        Standalone routine to compute local information theoretic measure for one variable in a 2D spatiotemporal multivariate array. Return a time-series array of local values. First history rows are zeros when the measure must build up embedded history of the variable. This method should be used for heterogeneous agents

        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series (1st index is time, 2nd index is variable number)
        col - index of the given variable
        Returns:
        time-series of local values of the measure for the given variable
